exceptions.tactic: intros a b c nZa nZb p q canon_p canon_q eq_ab div_a_c.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (a b c : Term A n) (nZc : ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) c) (p q : list (Term A n)), canonical A0 eqA ltM p -> canonical A0 eqA ltM q -> eqTerm eqA (n:=n) a b -> divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a c -> eqP A eqA n (spminusf a c nZc p q) (spminusf b c nZc p q)

Premises:
zeroP : forall A : Type, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> Prop
eqTerm : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> Term A n -> Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
canonical : forall A : Type, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, (mon n -> mon n -> Prop) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop

eqP : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop

```coq
intros a b c nZa nZb p q canon_p canon_q eq_ab div_a_c.
unfold spminusf.
unfold pluspf.
unfold eqP.
rewrite mults_dist_minuspf with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) by exact cs.
rewrite mults_dist_minuspf with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) by exact cs.
rewrite <- pluspf_is_minuspf with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) by exact cs.
exact eq_ab.
```

original: intros a b c nZa nZb p q canon_p canon_q eq_ab div_a_c. unfold spminusf. unfold pluspf. unfold eqP. rewrite mults_dist_minuspf with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) by apply cs. rewrite mults_dist_minuspf with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) by apply cs. rewrite <- pluspf_is_minuspf with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) by apply cs. apply eq_ab.
